definition: to raise/to lift up (curtains, clothing etc)
to lift up (sth hanging down)/to raise (hem of skirt)/to pull up (sleeve)/to sprinkle (water with cupped hands)
to tease/to provoke/to stir up (emotions)

to rise/to raise/to get up/to set out/to start/to appear/to launch/to initiate (action)/to draft/to establish/to get (from a depot or counter)/verb suffix, to start/starting from (a time, place, price etc)/classifier for occurrences or unpredictable events: case, instance/classifier for groups: batch, group

sentences.english: The little old lady pulls off her knickers and lifts up her dress.
sentences.chinese: 只見小老太太脫下短褲，撩起上衣。

sentences.english: He tucked my hair behind my ear and gave me a half smile.
sentences.chinese: 他撩起我耳朵後頭發，咧着嘴微微一笑。

sentences.english: Raise the curtain, see the city of lights.
sentences.chinese: 撩起窗簾，看城市的華燈初上。

sentences.english: She tucked up her skirt and waded across the stream.
You can always count on one of them to hold your hair when you vomit.
sentences.chinese: 當你嘔吐時，總會有人幫你把頭髮撩起來。

sentences.english: He even pulled up his shirt to show me his toned and tanned abs on his new washboard stomach.
sentences.chinese: 他甚至撩起襯衫給我看他那健美膚色強健的腹肌。

sentences.english: I had piqued her curiosity. She sat down again.
sentences.chinese: 我撩起了她的好奇心，她又坐了下來。

sentences.english: Nip your shirt up,let me look at your injury.
sentences.chinese: 撩起上衣，讓我看看你的受傷處。

sentences.english: She tucked up her skirt and waded into the river.
sentences.chinese: 她撩起裙子蹚水走進河裏。

sentences.english: You can always count on one of them to hold your hair back when you vomit.
sentences.chinese: 當你嘔吐時，總會有人幫你把頭髮撩起來。

definition: to push aside (clothing, curtain etc) to reveal something/to toss aside
the front piece(s) of a Chinese jacket/lapel
to lift open/to tear open
the sleeve of a garment
to raise one's head/to perk up
to take off (trousers)/to drop one's pants
corner of the lower hem of a jacket etc
to push aside/to part/to brush away
(of a breeze) to make (hair, leaves, clothing etc) sway gently/to ruffle
to lean forward/to lean out (of a window, door etc)
to reach out with one's hand/to hold out a hand/(fig.) to beg/to get involved/to meddle
sleeve
to grasp firmly
to grab
to move to and fro (with hand, foot, stick etc)/to fiddle with/to stir up
curtain
